page.title: 01GEOGRAPHICAL ENVIRONMENT
page.content:
{LANDSCAPE}
The block of which the village of Westbury forms the centre lies on either slope of the valley of the River Great Ouse.Gradients are gentle, the highest point on the block being 120 metres A.S.L. and the lowest 90 metres in the valley of the Ouse. Since the underlying rock is limestone, there is only surface drainage where either drift deposits of clay have made the rock impervious or where the water table is close to the surface.Westbury itself nestles in a slight hollow on the south facing north slope of the Ouse valley and from a distance is almost invisible among the patchwork of fields and the tall deciduous trees which separate them.
